alert.note: Alert for Kennebec; Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 18 at 12:54PM EDT until June 19 at 10:40PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gray ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Kennebec and Somerset Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kennebec River at Skowhegan. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...Flooding begins at campgrounds along the river near Skowhegan. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM EDT Sunday the flow was 29,410.0 cfs and rising. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this afternoon to 45,930.0 cfs just after midnight tonight. It will then fall and remain below flood stage tomorrow afternoon to around 30,000.0 cfs, holding through Tuesday before falling again. - Flood flow is 35,000.0 cfs. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
